choices.text: Marsupialization
Antibiotics
Incision and drainage
Cystectomy

questions.text: A painless lump is seen on the left side of the vaginal opening at the gynecological appointment of a 28 year old woman. She has no fever, or pain but does mention pain on sitting and during her routine bicycling rides. What would be the treatment of choice?
questions.solution:
The given condition shows features of Bartholin's cyst. Since the patient has no fever or pain or other systemic symptoms associated with infection or abscess formation, it can be diagnosed as a Bartholin's cyst. Marsupialization is the treatment of choice for a Bartholin cysts

Incorrect answers:

B: No features particular to infection by bacteria and thus antibiotics not necessary.

C: I&D would be TOC for Bartholin's abscess.

D: marsupialization is the treatment preferred.

Reference: William's gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 3, page number:86.

choices.text: They are gram positive darkly staining cocci
Their growth is anaerobic at ph 5
Present throughout the vagina
Acts of the glycogen present in the vaginal serosa

questions.text: A patient comes with altered vaginal PH. Which of the following is true then about the altered vaginal commensal?
questions.solution:
The affected organisms are the lactobacilli, also known as Doderlein's bacilli.

They are normally grow and maintain the vaginal PH at 4-4.5. They are sugar fermenters and convert glycogen of the vaginal epithelium into lactic acid thus maintaining the acidic ph.

They have anaerobic growth in the vaginal PH as well as acidic media as that at PH < 7.

Incorrect answers:

A: They are gram positive bacteria, but they are rod shaped bacilli appear in clusters of few on microscopy.

C: They are present only in the upper 2/3rd of the vaginal; and are thus in the highest concentration their maintaining the most acidic PH at that site.

D: they act on the glycogen present in the vaginal epithelium. Vagina as a structure lacks serosa, which is present only in the cul de sac area posteriorly.

Reference: William's Gynecology, 4th edition, Chapter 3 page number:60 to 65.

choices.text: Cardinal ligament
Round ligament
Levator ani
Uterosacral ligament

questions.text: Which of the following do not have a role in preventing the descent of uterus ?
questions.solution:
The supports of uterus are as follows:

  • Broad ligament and round ligament form guy ropes
  • They have no role in preventing the descent of uterus

References: D.C. dutta textbook of gynecology. Chapter 16, displacement of uterus, page number:167

choices.text: If PH >4.5, saline microscopy: 'clue cells'; advice Nugent scoring to be done
If profuse frothy greenish yellow discharge seen as well as a strawberry vagina: treatment of partner not required

Examination shows erythema, edema as well as white curdy discharge: saline microscopy will likely show: motile flagellated organisms; gold standard investigation would be done on Feinberg-whittington media
If splash dysuria seen along with negative amine test: administer fluconazole topically

questions.text: A 27 year old pregnant female with 10 weeks of amenorrhea; presents with discomfort in the vulva. She gives history of foul smelling discharge. Which of the following would be appropriate?
questions.solution:
Pregnancy is one of the predisposing condition of Vulvo vaginitis. A history of fowl smelling discharge associated with discomfort in vulva can be associated to all of the following conditions. However the only appropriate one would be if pH is increased above 4.5 and saline microscopy shows 'clue cells' is characteristic of bacterial vaginitis.

It is usually not associated with irritation as inflammation is not seen and thus there is no itching.

Incorrect answers:

B: Profuse frothy greenish yellow discharge as well as strawberry vagina is characteristic of trichomonas vaginitis, this being an STI treatment of partner should always be done drug of choice would be metronidazole which can be administered in pregnancy for 250 mg TDS 7 days.

C: Candidiasis which is again predisposed by conditions with increased estrogen such as pregnancy OC pills and mid cycle.

  • There is curdy white discharge and would be associated with intense pleuritis
  • Saline microscopy should show pseudo hyphae of the fungi. Since this is an STD the partner as well as the patient should be treated
  • treatment of choice would be the azole group of antifungals like fluconazole or miconazole topical or oral.
  • Gold standard investigation is Sabouraud's medium or Nickerson medium.

D: Splash dysuria along with negative amine test is indicative of Candidiasis, however since the patient is pregnant topical azole antifungals should be avoided in the first trimester as indicated by the 10 week amenorrhea.

Check out the table:

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 3, page number:63.

choices.text: Lesions start as an erythematous plaque
Small vesicle forming ulcers and blanching halo and a yellow base
Inguinal lymph nodes enlarged
Tissue culture for diagnosis

questions.text: 23 year old female patient presents with severe discomfort and burning in the genital area. She had minor systemic features of fever. She is sexually active. Examination reveals ulcers. Which of the following does not warrant the treatment with Acyclovir?
questions.solution:
The treatment with acyclovir and the young sexually active patient suggests herpetic ulcers.

HSV-2 is the most common cause of genital ulcers.

These ulcers are smaller vesicles which later turn into ulcers with clean yellow base but distinct erythematous/darker halo around the site.

Incorrect answers:

A: Lesions do begin as erythematous plaques which later becomes a vesicle.

C: Inguinal lymph nodes are enlarged and the ulcers are very tender.

D: Gold standard for diagnosis is Tissue culture.

Reference: William's Gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 3, page number:58.

choices.text: Most common cause: gold standard investigation - tissue biopsy on anaerobic medium
Ascending infection with acid fast bacilli
If postmenopausal: pale pink lactose fermenting bacilli on Macconkey agar
Descending infection: Violent string adhesions on laparoscopy

questions.text: A female patient presents with lower abdominal pain and systemic symptoms of fever, malaise and raised ESR and CRP. Examination reveals cervical motion tenderness as well as lower abdominal tenderness, as well as mucopurulent discharge. Which holds true for etiology and its diagnosis?
questions.solution:
The case is likely of female with PID.

PID can be diagnosed by;

  • Laparoscopy:
    • Dilated and hyperemia tube
    • Pyosalpinx
    • Tuboovarian mass
  • Organisms which cause PID are varied. However, if presentation is in a postmenopausal woman: the most likely organism is E. coli.
  • They are lactose fermenting rod shaped organisms which produce pale pink colonies on Macconkey agar.

Incorrect answers:

A: The most common cause is Chlamydia; however the gold standard for the infection is NAAT: Creatine in McCoy cells.

Tissue biopsy is is the gold standard for actinomycetes infection which usually occurs due to IUCD.

B: TB is the single cause of PID which is not caused by an ascending route along with transfer of sperms.

D: Violent string adhesions on laparoscopy are characteristic of gonococcal or chlamydia infection which go along the route:Vagina → Endocervix → Upper reproductive tract → fallopian tubes → peritoneum: on healing forms adhesions.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 3, page number:68, 270

choices.text: Suppression of ovulation
Thickening of cervical mucus
Creating a toxic environment for sperm
Inhibition of implantation through hormonal release

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman visits the gynecology clinic seeking a long-term, non-hormonal contraceptive method. She has no significant past medical history, is in a stable monogamous relationship, and desires contraception that requires minimal daily attention. She reports regular menstrual cycles and no known allergies. After discussing various options, she is interested in the Copper T 380A IUD. Based on the patient's preference for a non-hormonal, long-term contraceptive method, and her decision to use the Copper T 380A IUD, what is the primary mechanism by which this IUD prevents pregnancy?
questions.solution:
OPTION C) Creating a toxic environment for sperm:

This is the primary mechanism of action for the Copper T 380A IUD. The copper ions released by the IUD create an inflammatory reaction within the uterine cavity that is toxic to sperm. This reaction impairs sperm motility and viability, reducing their ability to fertilize an egg. Additionally, the copper ions disrupt the sperm's ability to undergo capacitation and the acrosome reaction, which are critical for fertilization. As a result, the Copper T 380A IUD effectively prevents pregnancy through this non-hormonal mechanism

OPTION A) Suppression of ovulation:

This mechanism is associated with hormonal contraceptives, such as birth control pills, patches, and hormonal IUDs. These methods work primarily by suppressing the release of eggs from the ovaries (ovulation). However, Copper T 380A IUD is non-hormonal and does not affect the ovulation process. Therefore, this option is incorrect for the Copper T 380A IUD.

OPTION B) Thickening of cervical mucus:

Thickening of cervical mucus is another mechanism utilized by hormonal contraceptives, particularly those containing progestin. Thicker mucus creates a barrier that makes it difficult for sperm to travel through the cervix and reach the egg. However, the Copper T 380A IUD does not contain hormones, so it does not work by altering cervical mucus.

OPTION D) Inhibition of implantation through hormonal release:

Hormonal IUDs, such as those containing levonorgestrel, may partially prevent pregnancy by inhibiting implantation through the hormonal effects on the endometrium. However, the Copper T 380A IUD does not release hormones and thus does not inhibit implantation through hormonal means. It primarily works by affecting sperm function rather than by altering the uterine lining in a hormonal way. This option is incorrect for the Copper T 380A IUD.

Key takeaway: The Copper T 380A IUD primarily prevents pregnancy by releasing copper ions that create an inflammatory and toxic environment for sperm within the uterine cavity, impairing their motility and function, thus preventing fertilization.

Reference: Shaw's Gynaecology 17th edition, Page number:261

choices.text: Bead string appearance on USG
Waist sign on USG
USG: mass with thin regular walls and areas of mixed echogenicity without septations
USG: mass with thick irregular walls and areas of mixed echogenicity with septations

questions.text: A patient comes with high fever, pain and lower abdominal tenderness. On palpation there is palpable mass on the right side. Which of the following is not seen:
questions.solution:
The presentation likely suggest a tuboovarian mass alongside PID.

  • This is a potentially life threatening condition which may lead to rapture as well as peritonitis.
  • It may follow appendicitis, diverticulitis, IBD or surgery a close mimic of the condition is Periappendiceal Abscess.
  • The mass on usg will have irregular walls and areas of mixed echogenicity however there will be no septations and there may be internal hyperechoic debris.

Incorrect answers:

all of these signs are found on USD examination of tubal inflammation as well as tuboovarian mass.

A: 'bead string appearance' is seen when inflamed tubes are imaged in cross section it also shows cogwheel appearance due to endosalpingeal fold.

B: waist sign, with diametrically opposite indentations, on longitudinal section.

D: the mass has thick irregular walls, areas of mixed echogenicity with septations and internal hyperechoic debris.

Reference: williams gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 3, page number 70 - 71.

choices.text: Vaginal pH > 8; despite higher lactobacilli
Vagina wall: pale pink appearance with rugae
TVS: ovaries show several small anechoic smooth walled cysts
TVS: ovaries smaller volume, few to none smooth walled cysts

questions.text: A 37 year old presents with secondary amenorrhea since 3 months. She suspects pregnancy but UPT is negative. Serum assay shows high FSH and LH. Which of the following is true?
questions.solution:
Option D: This is characteristic of menopause. The condition presented as premature menopause defined by secondary amenorrhea < 40 years of age, likely due to ovarian failure.

Clinical criteria:

  • minimum 3 months of secondary amenorrhea
  • high FSH levels
  • high LH levels
  • FSH:LH ratio is raised.
  • Estrogen reduced.

Incorrect answers:

A: vaginal pH> 8 is true as the vagina slowly becomes alkaline, however lactobacilli also reduce correspondingly in numbers.

B: The vaginal rugae will show flattening, however pale pink appearance will be present

C: This is a normal description of the premenopausal ovaries on TVS.

Reference: Speroff's Gynaecology 9th edition, Page number:836

choices.text: Reduced estrogen production leads to reduced libido
Ovarian function completely stops while adrenal function increases slightly
Rise in FSH occurs disproportionate to rise in LH
Serum inhibin levels increase, while serum estradiol < 20 pg/ml

questions.text: Which of the following is true for a 53-year-old woman with over a year of amenorrhea with no other associated abnormalities?
questions.solution:
• The above given condition can be inferred to be menopause or perimenopausal state.
  • There is reduction in oocytes though ovarian failure, and thus depletion of ovarian follicles.
  • This in turn leads to anovulation and subsequent reduction in progesterone. The negative feedback on LH is lost and there is increase in LH.
  • FSH levels rise > 40 IU which is characteristic features of menopause.
  • The raise of LH as well as FSH is key feature of menopause, due to reduced function of the ovary and reduced release of estrogen and progesterone, but continued action of both hypothalamus and pituitary.
  • Clearance of these hormones occur through the kidneys.
  • However, the half-life of hormone LH ~ 20-30 minutes; half-life of FSH ~ 2.5-3 hours.
  • This leads to a faster and greater rise in FSH; ( increased by upto 20 times previous range) than that of LH (increased by 3 times the previous levels).

Incorrect answers:

A: Postmenopausal women have reduced function of the adrenal glands. This leads to reduced production of DHEAS and DHEA by 50-80% (adrenopause). This in turn leads to reduction of libido.

B: Ovarian function reduces significantly as the follicles are degraded, however the function of the adrenal glands also reduces.

D: Due to reduced ovarian follicles, S. estradiol decreases to under 20 pg/ mL, however the levels of inhibin also reduces, which is previously acted as negative feedback hormone for LH - this contributes to increased LH levels also.

Reference: William's Gynecology, 4th edition, Chapter 22, page number:473-475.

choices.text: Z score evaluation should be done prior to therapy
Rule out hypergonadism, glucocorticoid therapy, PPI, aromatase inhibitors
Administer agents preventing bone resorption: Raloxifene, Denosumab, Alendronate, Teripartide
Drug of choice inhibits IL-6 and should be used for a maximum of 5 years only

questions.text: A 63 year old female with absent menses for 8 years come to for routine check up. On testing testing BMD, the T score < -2.5SD. Which of the following is right?
questions.solution:
• Low bone density and subsequent osteoporosis is the most important morbidity associated with postmenopausal women.
  • BMD is tested using dual energy Xray absorptiometry, and its clinical state is assessed with the help of T score in older/post menopausal women.
  • T score < -2.5: osteoporosis.
  • The drug of choice in this case is Bisphosphonates.
  • This drugs reduces the bone resorption, acting on the osteoclast; both treating as well as preventing further osteoporosis.
  • They accelerate the apoptosis of osteoclasts and also inhibit the IL-6, leading to reduced differentiation precursors to osteoclasts.
  • Their long term side effects [ osteonecrosis of jaw, atypical femur fracture] as well as contraindication in poor renal function amongst others.
  • Due to the above, the bisphosphonates are only used upto 5 years.

Incorrect answers:

A: Z scores are used for the evaluation of younger patients and would not be necessary here.

B: while glucocorticoids > 3 months, PPIs,, aromatase inhibitors are all bone losing drugs, hypogonadism instead of hypergonadism is high risk factor for osteoporosis; these must screened and ruled out during history.

C: All the drugs except Teriparatide, act on osteoclasts and thus reduce bone resorption. Teriparatide acts on osteoblasts and thus promotes bone formation.

Reference: William's Gynecology, 4th edition, Chapter 22, page number:487-493.

choices.text: Lactational amenorrhea acts as contraception when : baby age up to 7 months, menses have not returned, breast feeding done once a day
Latex condoms are safe to use with Vaseline oils but polyurethrane condoms are not
Female condoms are prelubricated with dimethicone and protect against HIV and other STDS
Spermicidal jelly acts by inhibiting ovulation

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.solution:
Female condoms are prelubricated with silicone based dimethicone and do protect against HIV and other STDS.

  • Nitrile based female condoms are distributed by the government of India to female sex workers free of cost.

Incorrect answers:

A: lactational amenorrhea access contraception when:

  1. Exclusive breastfeeding is done with more than once a day feeds.
  2. Age of baby is under 6 months
  3. menses have not returned.

B: Latex condoms are not safe to be used with oil based lubricants such as Vaseline oil, skin lotions and cold cream.

  • These increase the chances of rupture.
  • If lubrication is needed spermicidal Jelly or KY Jelly should be used which are water based
  • polyurethane condoms can be used with oil based lubricants.

D: Spermicidal Jelly acts by disrupting the sperm cell membrane. They are effective when used in conjunction with mechanical barriers and give reliable contraceptive effect then.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 5, page number:112-118.

choices.text: Increase sex hormone binding globulin; absolute contraindication: smokers>35 years
Do not increase chances of venous thromboembolism; absolute contraindication: pregnancy
Break through bleeding rare; relative contraindication: mild hypertension
Increased risk of depression; relative contraindication: MV prolapse

questions.text: Which of the following is not true for 3rd generation OCPs?
questions.solution:
This is incorrect as they do increase the chances of venous thromboembolism; thrombophlebitis slash thromboembolic disorders [present history past history or family history] are all absolute contraindications WHO category 4.

Following are the contraindications of OCP:

Incorrect answers:

these are all true for 3rd generation OC pills

A: They do increase sex hormone binding globulin, which reduces free testosterone concentration which in turn reduces androgenic effects. Smoking over age 35 is an absolute contraindication.

C: They do reduce breakthrough bleeding; mild hypertension is a relative contraindication.

D: There is an increased risk of depression usually treated by vitamin b complex., relative contraindication: mitral valve prolapse

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th edition chapter 5, page number:121- 124.

choices.text: Cannot be used in breast cancer patients
Expulsion rate may be up to 6%
Can be used as an emergency contraceptive only after oligomenorrhea for 3 to 4 months of use
Increased risk off ectopic pregnancy when positive previous history of ectopic

questions.text: Which of the following is not a drawback of IUCD Mirena?
questions.solution:
IUCD MIRENA is a progesterone containing IUCD.

  • It has T shaped radio opaque polyethylene frame with the stem carrying polymethylsiloxane - levonorgestrel.
  • It contains 52 milligram levonorgestrel, eluting 20mcg daily.
  • While it can be used in the treatment of endometrial hyperplasia, Adenomyosis, Uterine leiomyomas and Endometriosis; it should never be used as an emergency contraceptive.

Incorrect answers

A: It cannot be used in breast cancer patients or any cancer responsive to progesterone.

B: Expulsion seen in up to 5 to 6 % cases

D: Women who have had previous ectopic pregnancy may show an increased risk for another due to their diminished tubal motility from progesterone action.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th edition, chapter 5, page number:114-115.

choices.text: Within 48 hrs
1-3 weeks
4-6 weeks
A year or more later

questions.text: Vesicovaginal fistula following hysterectomy typically present at what time post-surgery?
questions.solution:
OPTION B) 1-3 weeks:

Vesicovaginal fistula often presents within 1-3 weeks post-surgery. This timing allows enough time for the tissue necrosis or ischemia leading to fistula formation to become evident. Early symptoms such as continuous urinary leakage or persistent vaginal discharge may become noticeable during this period.

OPTION A) Within 48 hours:

Vesicovaginal fistula generally does not present so early after hysterectomy. Immediate postoperative complications are more likely to be related to surgical trauma or infection rather than fistula formation.

OPTION C) 4-6 weeks:

While fistulas can present within 4-6 weeks, they are typically identified earlier. This window is more common for less acute complications or for cases where initial symptoms may have been subtle or overlooked.

OPTION D) A year or more later:

Vesicovaginal fistula usually presents much earlier than a year post-surgery. If a fistula appears a year or more later, it is often due to other causes, such as radiation therapy or chronic disease, rather than a direct result of the hysterectomy itself.

Key takeaway: To remember: Timing of surgical repair:

  • Due to obstructed labor: Repair after 6 weeks(time for infection and inflammation subsides)
  • Due to Surgery:
    • If diagnosed within 24 hrs: repair immediately
    • If diagnosed after 24 hrs: repair after 6 weeks
  • Due to radiotherapy: Repair after 12 months

Reference: www.uptodate.com
